reviews.review_msg: Go into a Dodge course ready to work and you'll be fine.  If you want a physics professor that knows his stuff and will reward you for your effort, his courses are for you.  Nice guy when you get to know him.  In a nutshell, taking a class with him is high risk (do you have the will-power) - high reward.

He is a highly trained researcher whom leads you to the answer of a question rather than telling students answers. For those of you who will be taking 355, I stongly encourage you to read more about fourier transform and pay attention to your finger prints when holding a glass water cup.  *it's on the hw*
Deadly.  He's used to teaching people at an advanced level and tends to trample students who are not highly adept at prerequisite math.  Gives excessively difficult assignments.
